title: Stoked by Republicans, Fears of Crime Loom Large for Midterm Voters
description: Republican candidates are focusing on crime and public safety, but their message is rooted not so much in data or policy as in votersâ€™ feelings of unease.
dc:creator: Julie Bosman, Jack Healy and Campbell Robertson

media:content.media:credit: Michelle Gustafson for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Across the country, Republican candidates have sought to blame Democrats for crime problems. Billboards in Philadelphia attacked the Democratic candidate for U.S. Senate, John Fetterman.
